page.title: 19Charleston Manor
page.content: The present owners of this historic house,mentioned in the Domesday Book,have organised,since 1984, an Annual Festival of Music in their 15th century Tithe Barn.Their aim is to create a balance between attracting enough financial sponsership to make the event viable and not to over commercialise the Festival. A summer evening's programme at Charleston Manor in 1985 included facilities for picnics in the rose garden where the Charleston String Quartet were playing,prior to a recital by an international artist such as Julian Bream the celebrated guitarist.After the concert,dinner was served by candlelight in a marquee,while the string quartet continued to play.An Art and Sculpture Exhibition was held during the Festival.The Great Barn is also used by charities for fundraising
